New Records: Mark Vientos matched Daniel Murphy's total of 11 RBIs in a single postseason, one shy of the Mets record of 12 held by Curtis Granderson and John Olerud.
Key Match Events: Mark Vientos hit a grand slam after Francisco Lindor was intentionally walked, leading the Mets to a 7-3 win over the Dodgers in NLCS Game 2.
Francisco Lindor led off NLCS Game 2 with a homer, snapping the Dodgers' record-tying 33-inning scoreless streak.
Vientos' grand slam was the Mets' second grand slam of the month and one of 13 teams to hit multiple slams in a postseason.
Vientos' grand slam was the fourth postseason grand slam this century to occur immediately after an intentional walk.
Post-Match Reflections: Mark Vientos expressed his motivation after being intentionally walked, stating 'I took it personal.'
Teammate J.D. Martinez praised Vientos for his 'South Florida grit' and confidence.
Francisco Lindor highlighted Vientos' confidence and growth as a player.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets' bullpen, including Sean Manaea, Phil Maton, Ryne Stanek, and Edwin Díaz, contributed to the victory by managing key innings.
